entry.title: his car on coinage (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a Chinese warlord put his car on coinage (pictured), in lieu of his own portrait?

entry.title: Jude Law (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the English actor Jude Law is actually named David, a result of his parents naming their children after their best friends?

entry.title: a portrait (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a portrait was attributed to the wrong painter for many years, and the sitter was also misidentified?

entry.title: Detroit Sign (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that an AI rendering of the Detroit Sign misled people into thinking that it would be larger than it actually is?

entry.title: Flemish bond (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that bricks laid in Flemish bond were a sign of wealth in colonial Virginia?

entry.title: Ditto Pölzl (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the communist trade unionist Ditto Pölzl was a member of all three provisional state governments of Styria in 1945?

entry.title: East Wake Academy (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that when East Wake Academy opened, its two main school buildings were located four miles (6 km) apart in separate towns?

entry.title: John White (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that John White shot himself after it was discovered that he had plagiarized a speech by Aaron Burr?

entry.title: Homeworld: Vast Reaches (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that within the mixed-reality mode of Homeworld: Vast Reaches, ships seem to fly around the player's room?
